data.title: Grand Duchess Maria Pavlovna of Russia (1890–1958)
data.meta_description:
Known as "Maria Pavlovna the Younger" she was the daughter of Grand Duke Paul Alexandrovich of Russia and Grand Duchess Alexandra Georgievna, ( née Princess Alexandra of Greece).  She was usually called "Marie," the French version of her name.
	
	Maria's mother died soon after she had given birth to Maria's brother Grand Duke Dmitri Pavlovich of Russia, when little Maria was under two years old.  
	
	In 1902 her father married Olga Valerianovna Paley; as the marriage was unapproved by Nicholas II, he was exiled.   Maria and her brother  were placed in the custody of Grand Duke Sergei Alexandrovich, and his wife  Grand Duchess Elizabeth Feodorovna (née Princess Elisabeth of Hesse and by Rhine).  
	
	In 1908 Maria married Prince Wilhelm, Duke of Södermanland, they had one son;  Prince Lennart, Duke of Småland (later Count of Wisborg).  The marriage was not successful and the couple divorced in 1914.  
	
	Maria married again to Prince Sergei Mikhailovich Putiatin, in September 1917, and had another son; Prince Roman Sergeievich Putiatin.  Maria and Sergei fled Russia in 1919, leaving their son in the care of his paternal grandparents. Not long after they received a letter informing them that baby Roman had died. 
	
	Maria died at the age of sixty-eight in 1958 in the border town of Konstanz in West Germany,  and was buried beside her brother Dimitri in the vault of the church in Mainau, a possession of her son Lennart.
data.text:
Known as "Maria Pavlovna the Younger" she was the daughter of Grand Duke Paul Alexandrovich of Russia and Grand Duchess Alexandra Georgievna, ( née Princess Alexandra of Greece). She was usually called "Marie," the French version of her name.

Maria's mother died soon after she had given birth to Maria's brother Grand Duke Dmitri Pavlovich of Russia, when little Maria was under two years old.

In 1902 her father married Olga Valerianovna Paley; as the marriage was unapproved by Nicholas II, he was exiled. Maria and her brother were placed in the custody of Grand Duke Sergei Alexandrovich, and his wife Grand Duchess Elizabeth Feodorovna (née Princess Elisabeth of Hesse and by Rhine).

In 1908 Maria married Prince Wilhelm, Duke of Södermanland, they had one son; Prince Lennart, Duke of Småland (later Count of Wisborg). The marriage was not successful and the couple divorced in 1914.

Maria married again to Prince Sergei Mikhailovich Putiatin, in September 1917, and had another son; Prince Roman Sergeievich Putiatin. Maria and Sergei fled Russia in 1919, leaving their son in the care of his paternal grandparents. Not long after they received a letter informing them that baby Roman had died.

Maria died at the age of sixty-eight in 1958 in the border town of Konstanz in West Germany, and was buried beside her brother Dimitri in the vault of the church in Mainau, a possession of her son Lennart.
